Elements Introduction

Amplitude.js comes with a variety of elements. Each element is picked up by a class prefixed with ‘amplitude-‘ and depending on the environment, an attribute that relates to the index of a song in your list of songs or a playlist you are using the element with. There are elements that some events are bound to such as play and next and other elements that get filled with meta data information about the active audio.

All elements can be styled simply based off of class or if you want to define specific ids in CSS. Besides album art, you could apply these classes to a variety of elements. Album art has to be an element, but the other elements could be whatever.
